conclusion: Determine the total energy stored in the cylindrical capacitor before any fluid rises.
A cylindrical capacitor consists of two concentric cylinders with lengths l, inner radius a, and outer radius b.
Capacitance C of the cylindrical capacitor is calculated using the formula C = (2πκε₀l)/ln(b/a).
The energy U stored in a capacitor is given by the formula U = (1/2)CV².
Substitute the expression for capacitance into the energy formula to get U = (1/2)((2πκε₀l)/ln(b/a))V².
Simplify the expression to obtain U = (πκε₀lV²)/ln(b/a).
The total energy stored in the cylindrical capacitor before any fluid rises is U = (πκε₀lV²)/ln(b/a).
